name: Gmail (Legacy) modules
title: Gmail (Legacy) modules

children.text: After connecting to the Gmail app, you can use the following modules to build your
Triggers when a new email is received to be processed according to specified criteria.

data.label: Gmail
data.overridedLabel: Create a connection to your Gmail account

children.text: Select the email folder you want to watch.
to filter emails by selecting criteria, or
to filter emails by entering the query.
Select the option to filter watched emails by.
. To search for messages containing an icon of a specific color, use the following search query:
Enter the email addresses that you want to filter emails by.
Enter the characters string in the email subject that you want to filter emails by.
Enter the characters string in the email subject or body that you want to filter emails by.
Mark email message(s) as read when fetched
Select whether you want to mark retrieved emails as read.
Set the maximum number of results that Make will work with during one cycle.
Copies an email or a draft into a selected folder.

data.label: Gmail
data.overridedLabel: Create a connection to your Gmail account

children.text: Select the email source folder that contains an email you want to copy.
Select the email destination folder where you want to copy an email to.
Enter the ID of the email you want to copy. To get the Email ID (UID), use the
module. You will see the value in the output.
Creates a new draft and adds it to a selected folder.

data.label: Gmail
data.overridedLabel: Create a connection to your Gmail account

children.text: Select the folder you want to add a draft to.
Enter the email message body. You can use HTML tags.

File name  	  Enter the name of the file to be uploaded, including the file extension. For example, myFile.png.     Data  	  Enter the file data. Refer to our Help Center to learn how to work with files.
Enter the copy recipient's email address. (CC:)
Enter the blind copy recipient's email address. (BCC:)
Removes an email or a draft from a selected folder.

data.label: Gmail
data.overridedLabel: Create a connection to your Gmail account

children.text: Enter the ID of the message you want to delete. To get the Gmail Message ID, use the
module. You will see the value in the output.
Select whether you want to move the email to the thrash folder or to permanently delete it.
Marks an email or a draft in a selected directory as read by setting the "Read" flag.

data.label: Gmail
data.overridedLabel: Create a connection to your Gmail account

children.text: Select the folder that contains the email you want to mark as Read.
Enter the ID of the email you want to copy. To get the Email ID (UID), use the
module. You will see the value in the output.
Marks an email or a draft in a selected directory as read by setting the "Unread" flag.

data.label: Gmail
data.overridedLabel: Create a connection to your Gmail account

children.text: Select the folder that contains the email you want to mark as Unread.
Enter the ID of the email you want to copy. To get the Email ID (UID), use the
module. You will see the value in the output.
Modifies labels on the specified email message.

data.label: Gmail
data.overridedLabel: Create a connection to your Gmail account

children.text: Enter the ID of the message whose labels you want to modify. To get the Gmail Message ID, use the
module. You will see the value in the output.
Select the labels you want to attach to the email.
Select the labels you want to detach from the email.
Moves a chosen email to a selected folder.

data.label: Gmail
data.overridedLabel: Create a connection to your Gmail account

children.text: Select the email source folder that contains an email you want to move.
Select the email destination folder where you want to move an email to.
Enter the ID of the email you want to copy. To get the Email ID (UID), use the
module. You will see the value in the output.

data.label: Gmail
data.overridedLabel: Create a connection to your Gmail account

children.text: Enter a custom sender email address.
There are two options for entering:
a custom name in quotes before a custom sender email address:
an email address that you're already connected with:
Enter the email message body. You can use HTML tags.

File name Enter the name of the file to be uploaded, including the file extension. For example, myFile.png. Data Enter the file data. Refer to our Help Center to learn how to work with files. Content ID Enter a Content ID to attach inline images. This allows you to create an ID for the attachment, which you can then use in HTML: where ii_jrc3r9mw1 is a content ID.
Enter the copy recipient's email address. (CC:)
Enter the blind copy recipient's email address. (BCC:)
Select another Gmail module whose output contains attachments you want to iterate.

customCSS:
<style>
@media print {
  html, body {
    overflow-x: visible;
  }
}
#tally-widget-button {
  position: fixed !important;
  background-color: #FFFFFF;
  display: none;
  visibility: visible !important;
  opacity: 1 !important;
  color: #0C121D;
  border: 2px solid #0C121D;
  border-radius: 4px;
  align-items: center;
  justify-content: center;
  font-size: 14px;
  font-weight: 600;
  font-family: 'Inter';
  text-align: center;
  box-shadow: 0 4px 6px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.2);
  cursor: pointer;
  z-index: 999999 !important;
  -webkit-tap-highlight-color: transparent;
  outline: none;
  touch-action: manipulation;
  pointer-events: auto;
  transform: translate3d(0, 0, 0);
}
.button-text {
  display: inline-block;
  margin-right: 8px;
}
.button-text::before {
  content: attr(data-text);
}
#tally-widget-popup {
  position: fixed;
  background-color: white;
  display: none;
  border-radius: 12px;
  box-shadow: 0 10px 20px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.4);
  z-index: 999999;
  overflow: hidden;
  border: 0px solid #0C121D;
  padding-top: 30px;
}
#tally-widget-close {
  position: absolute;
  top: 10px;
  right: 10px;
  background: none;
  border: none;
  font-size: 36px;
  font-weight: bold;
  padding: 8px;
  cursor: pointer;
  color: #0C121D;
}

  .ab-plugin-wrapper .ab-link-block-item .ab-link {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
    font-family: 'Inter' !important;
  }

  .dark .ab-plugin-wrapper .ab-link-block-item .ab-link {
    color: #F6F6F6 !important;
  }
  
  #main-column > div > div > div.flex.flex-1.w-full.justify-center.pb-0 > div > div.flex.items-center.pl-0.pr-2.mb-5.xl\:-mt-1\.5 > div > div > div > div:nth-child(1) > div.flex.pr-2.text-gray-500.items-center {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  a.ab-tree-navigation-link-active span {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  .ab-public-space-links-wrap .ab-public-space-link:first-of-type {
    border-color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  .ab-toc-item-active a{
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  #main-column .text-ab-blue-500 span {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  
  #main-column .text-ab-blue-500 {
    text-decoration-color: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  .ab-nav-left:hover > svg,
  .ab-nav-left:hover .text-gray-300,
  .ab-nav-left:hover .ab-nav-left-text {
     color: #7302D5 !important;
     stroke: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  .ab-nav-right:hover > svg,
  .ab-nav-right:hover .text-gray-300,
  .ab-nav-right:hover .ab-nav-right-text {
     color: #7302D5 !important;
     stroke: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  
#tally-inline-popup {
  position: fixed;
  display: none;
  z-index: 999999;
  width: min(420px, 90vw);
  height: min(550px, 80vh);
  background: #fff;
  color: #0c121d;
  border: 1px solid rgba(0,0,0,0.08);
  border-radius: 12px;
  box-shadow: 0 12px 28px rgba(0,0,0,0.22), 0 2px 6px rgba(0,0,0,0.12);
  overflow: hidden;
  padding: 5px;
}

#tally-inline-popup iframe {
  width: 100%;
  height: 100%;
  border: 0;
  display: block;
  border-radius: 8px;
}

#tally-inline-popup .tip-close {
  position: absolute;
  top: 6px;
  right: 8px;
  width: 32px;
  height: 32px;
  line-height: 28px;
  font-size: 22px;
  text-align: center;
  background: rgba(255,255,255,0.85);
  border: 1px solid rgba(0,0,0,0.06);
  border-radius: 8px;
  cursor: pointer;
}

#main-column a[data-form-url],
#main-column a[data-tally-url] {
  color: #7302D5 !important;
  text-decoration: underline;
  text-underline-offset: 2px;
  text-decoration-thickness: 1.5px;
  font-weight: 600;
}

@media (max-width: 640px) {
  #tally-inline-popup {
    width: min(360px, 94vw);
    height: min(500px, 80vh);
  }
}

#main-column .ab-cta-button a.ab-cta-button {
  background-color: #7302D5;
}

/* Titles in purple */
.ab-link-blocks-wrapper .ab-link-block-item.ab-docs-card-mode .ab-link-block-content-wrap .font-bold {
  color: #7302D5 !important;
}

.ab-tree-navigation-link-active span {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
}

</style>

reusableContentVariables.name: string
reusableContentVariables.description: a list or sequence of characters (like letters, numbers, and symbols) used to represent text in a computer programming.

reusableContentVariables.name: Operations
reusableContentVariables.description: An operation is a single module run to process data or check for new data.

reusableContentVariables.name: Credits
reusableContentVariables.description: Credits (formerly operations) are the currency for running scenarios.

reusableContentVariables.name: Route
reusableContentVariables.description: A route is a path that data can flow through in a scenario, visualized as the dotted lines between modules.
